document_data.mainbody: ''Echo gates''''', or '''''ring-of-fire gates''''', were a magical practice devised by [[Ahghairon]], the first [[Open Lord]] of [[Waterdeep]], which employed the existing ''[[gate]]s'' of [[Undermountain]] to bypass wards against ''[[teleport]]''-type [[spell]]s across [[Waterdeep]].{{cite book/Elminster in Hell/Hardcover 2001|163-164|10}}
document_data.Effects: An ''echo gate'' could be cast into areas that were otherwise warded in ways that could be reasonably expected to protect against the creation of ''gates'' or the use of ''[[teleport]]ation'' spells.
document_data.History: ''Echo gates'' were first devised by Ahghairon, who found that leveraging the ''portals'' of [[Undermountain]] allowed for the creation of ''gates'' that bypassed most wards. He wrote a [[tome]] on the subject, which came to the possession of [[Amril Zoar]]. After mastering ''echo gates'', Amril set out on his rampage killing of the [[Lords of Waterdeep]] in the early [[Flamerule]] of the {{YearlinkName|1355}}.{{cite book/Elminster in Hell/Hardcover 2001|2|Realmslore}} After he was captured, and his killing prevented by [[Storm Silverhand]], [[Mirt]] reminded her to get the book from him anyway.
